title: Google Lunar XPRIZE, iPhone and nanotechnology feature in BBC documentary Tomorrow’s World: A Horizon Special
text:
Video Image Tomorrow's World 49:42 A dizzying journey into the mind-bending world technology is now creating for us - welcome to the forefront of pure innovation. What will the world of tomorrow be like?
August 14th 2015 2 months ago /video/video.news.com.au/TV/Current Affairs/ Liz Bonnin looks at some of the radical inventions of the 21st century.
News Corp Australia WELCOME to the world of invention, revealing the people and technologies set to transform all our lives.
This BBC documentary examines the conditions that are promising to make the 21st century a golden age of innovation and meets some of the world’s foremost visionaries, mavericks and dreamers.
The fast pace of the world today and collaborations that are changing the way innovations become reality.
Host Liz Bonnin inisde Hangar D4 at the United Kingdom’s Science Museum. Source: Supplied
Learn about future plans for mining and inhabiting the moon.
See how the transparent tape has created a new material, which is only one atom thick.
And find out how scientists plan to harvest the Sun’s energy through one of the world’s oldest organisms.
From the entrepreneurs that are driving a new space race, to the Nobel Prize wining scientist leading a nanotech revolution, this is a tour of the people and ideas delivering the world of tomorrow, today.
